subtitle: This light pudding is made with a rich batter. Choose really plump and ripe cherries and make sure the oven is well preheated before cooking the Clafouti.

method.text: Preheat oven to 200°C. Lightly butter a 1.5-1 <sup>4</sup>/<sub>5</sub> litre souffle dish.
Remove the stones from the cherries, using a proper cherry-stoner. Do this over a basin, so no juice is wasted.
Put the cherries and any juice into the bottom of the souffle dish. Cover the dish. Heat in the oven for about 5 min.
Beat the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the rest of the batter ingredients. Whisk until smooth.
Remove the heated dish with the cherries from the oven. Pour the batter over the cherries. Place in the oven for 30 min, or until well risen, and firm and golden in colour.
Top with a few extra cherries and sifted icing sugar. Serve immediately.

title: Cherry clafouti
